page.title: 02PURBROOK FIRST SCHOOL
page.content: In the centre of Purbrook Village,next to the church is {PURBROOK CHURCH OF {ENGLAND FIRST SCHOOL.} This school was built more than a hundred years ago in the 19th Century is still used as a state school for children between 5 and 8. There are 53 children in the school with two members of staff, a headteacher and one other member of staff. There is only one large main classroom in use but small room,originally used as living quarters for the headteacher,are now used for smaller groups of children. There is a very small playground for the children to play in,a small office and a headteacher's room. The children mainly live near to the school and are able to walk to school every day. When they leave the school most of them go to the local Middle School nearby.
